outline:
1. to scorn, make mouths at, talk arrogantly
    1. (Qal)
      1. to boast
      2. to scorn
    2. (Hiphil)
      1. to mock, deride
      2. to interpret (language)
        1. interpreter (participle)
        2. ambassador (fig.)
      3. (Hithpalpel) to be inflated, scoff, act as a scorner, show oneself a mocker
kjv_def: ambassador, have in derision, interpreter, make a mock, mocker, scorn(-er, -ful), teacher.
strongs_def: properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
